feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Friday Night... Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow are causing elevated surf. These winds will continue into Monday, then turn northwest Monday afternoon, and decrease Monday night. These winds are causing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Starting Friday Night... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop Friday night over the southern Chukchi Sea, and to continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
